instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges battery but will not run on battery. Only works when plugged in.
threads.message: This board had some minor liquid-damage. Computer works fine and charges the battery fine but if you unplug it, it can't start or run on battery. PPBUS is staying fine at 8.4V on <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR>. <TRANSISTOR>Q5500</TRANSISTOR> circuit seems to be working normally compared to a good board. <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR> are both fine. <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> area is clean. I added pre-ultrasonic cleaning pictures. Not sure if this is an SMC communication issue or something else. It's obviously communicating enough to charge so I'm guessing that part is fine but I'm not sure what would cause this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges battery but will not run on battery. Only works when plugged in.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> is the first suspect here...

Did you try known good working battery?
You can also test its battery in other machine.

Post <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> voltages with battery only.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges battery but will not run on battery. Only works when plugged in.
threads.message:
Yes, <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> is fine. Voltage getting through fine. It does have 3V42 on battery. To be sure I swapped <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR>. No change.

Tried with working good battery. No change. I have a test board too. Battery works fine with that one.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>
1-3: 8.4V
4: .875V
5: 8.4V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges battery but will not run on battery. Only works when plugged in.
threads.message:
Post <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> on battery only.
What says OSX about battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges battery but will not run on battery. Only works when plugged in.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> is at 0V, same as a good board. Diode mode on <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> is .711, same as my good board. If you look in the pictures though, this was one of the few areas that was hit by the spill. Slight corrosion. <RESISTOR>R5503</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5504</RESISTOR> are measuring fine though.

OSX sees the battery normally. Charges fine. Condition is Normal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges battery but will not run on battery. Only works when plugged in.
threads.message: Post <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> voltages with battery only, no charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges battery but will not run on battery. Only works when plugged in.
threads.message:
Ok, it looks like you've found the problem. Not sure what's causing it though. It has 3.3V on <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> while plugged in but it drops to .184V with battery-only. Other than that, all the values on <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> are the same as a good board. Same results testing with other good battery.

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> (Battery-Only)
1: 3.4V
2: GND
3: 3.4V
4: 2.7V
5: .184V
6: 3.3V
7: 3.4V
8: 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges battery but will not run on battery. Only works when plugged in.
threads.message: Replacing <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> made no difference, still at .184V. Replacing <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> raised <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> to .6V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges battery but will not run on battery. Only works when plugged in.
threads.message:
Remove <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> and check if <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high.
If yes, solder back <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> and change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Also you can remove J6100, if had corrosion close; not needed normally.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges battery but will not run on battery. Only works when plugged in.
threads.message: Done. Bad ISL. Thanks for getting me there.
